conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_D is one of my top choices because I’m looking for a rigorous environment where I can contribute consistently and grow. Those students also rank School_C highly (especially A and D as #2, C as #2), so applying there first risks rejection. School_D is my #2 and ranks me 4th, but importantly Student_D (who is #1 at School_D) is likely to apply to School_B first (their #1), and Student_A (ranked #2 at School_D) also likely applies to School_B first. That makes School_D a more realistic early match while still very high on my true list. I will apply to School_D now to lock in a strong option before competition shifts.

Student_E ranks School_D as 2nd (after School_C), so they may also be pursuing School_C, making early acceptance less valuable. Given we can reject and keep the seat open for higher-priority candidates, the optimal move is to reject Student_E now.
